Posts.Content: Hi, So glad that you were finally able to get someone to listen and get your appointment moved forward. I can't believe that doctors (or whoever does the scheduling) don't realize how difficult the waiting and not knowing is. You are in our prayers. Good luck with the test and keep us updated. Love, judy
Posts.Title: Another Test

Posts.Content: Hi Karen Rose, I didn't go thru chemo so I can't help you there but many others on this site will be able to give you some imput. I'm so glad your surgery is over and that your recovery is coming along. Welcome to this site. It's like one big family of sisters willing to share and help with questions and support. Take care and keep us updated on your progress. --Judy
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and now just memories of my left boob

Posts.Content: Hi Pam The girls here are right, you have always been a great inspiration to all of us. I'm glad you posted the update, we all have you in our hearts and prayers. Take good care of yourself (and your hubby) and we'll be thinking of you both. Best Wishes, Judy
Posts.Title: Now on Zeloda

Posts.Content: Take as long as you want. You earned it. Glad that things are going good....keep in touch. jbeardslee
Posts.Title: Let's live it up

Posts.Content: I'm trying Tony's suggestion of using Internet Explorer instead of Netscape to see if I can post to the site. Here goes! :) Hope everyone is doing well today. love, jbeardslee
Posts.Title: hi

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm 54 and was also told by my doctor that I should have a colonoscopy. He said not just because of breast cancer but also because of my age. I'm also estrogen +. I'm lucky in the fact that my surgeon is also the one to perform the test so I don't have to worry about meeting a new doctor this time. My colonoscopy is scheduled for Mon at 7:30 a.m. Take care. love, judy
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer & Colon Cancer

Posts.Content: Just an update on things......I had a call from the surgeons office yesterday. The results of the ultrasound done on Mon. warrant him doing another exam on me. They also mentioned a needle aspiration but I don't know it that will be done tomorrow or if I schedule that after the exam. Given my history of 2 years ago, this is a scary time. I'm praying the area in question will turn out to be benign and I can get back on an even path again. Thanks, Judy
Posts.Title: more appointments

Posts.Content: In the 2 years that I have taken Tamoxifen I have been warmer than normal. I'm anxious to see what the other ladies have to say about the side effect. Judy
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen question?
